answer: Delays over 24 hours in 46.2% of Technical Support and 42.3% of Account Issues cases may stem from staff adapting to recent software updates, while only 11.5% of General Inquiries experience similar delays.
followup: Can we predict the end-of-month resolution rate if no changes are made to current processes?
header: Technical and Account Issues drive significant delays
indicator: 46.2% of Technical Support and 42.3% of Account Issues cases exceed 24-hour resolution, compared to the 11.5% delay rate for simpler General Inquiries.
insight: A recent internal announcement noted a software update, which may be causing delays as staff adapt to the new system, contributing to the higher delay rates in Technical Support (46.2%) and Account Issues (42.3%).
plot_summary: 46.2% of Technical Support and 42.3% of Account Issues cases exceed 24 hours, with recent software updates and staff adaptation impacting delays.
question: Why do certain customer support cases take longer than 24 hours to resolve?
